articles.headline: Poll Finds G.O.P. Field Isn’t Touching Voters
articles.snippet: Democrats are happier than Republicans with their field of presidential candidates, a Times/CBS News poll finds.
articles.abstract: Democrats are happier than Republicans with their field of presidential candidates, a Times/CBS News poll finds.
articles.lead_paragraph: Three weeks before the Iowa caucuses, Republican voters across the country appear uninspired by their field of presidential candidates, with a vast majority saying they have not made a final decision about whom to support, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.
articles.byline: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and MEGAN THEE

articles.headline: Putin Backs Deputy Prime Minister as Successor
articles.snippet: With the endorsement, Dmitri A. Medvedev becomes the clear favorite to succeed President Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.abstract: With the endorsement, Dmitri A. Medvedev becomes the clear favorite to succeed President Vladimir V. Putin.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Dec. 10  President Vladimir V. Putin on Monday endorsed as his successor Dmitri A. Medvedev, a protégé with no background in the state security services and virtually no power base in the Kremlin.

articles.headline: Black Given Prison Term Over Fraud
articles.snippet: Conrad M. Black was sentenced to 6 1/2 years in prison for fleecing shareholders of Hollinger International out of millions of dollars.
articles.abstract: Conrad M. Black was sentenced to 6 1/2 years in prison for fleecing shareholders of Hollinger International out of millions of dollars.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Dec. 10  In the months since his convictions in July on fraud and obstruction of justice charges, Conrad M. Black, the fallen press baron who once presided over the world’s third-largest newspaper empire, was not above poking fun at himself as he waited to see how long he would spend in prison.

articles.headline: UBS Records a Big Write-Down and Sells a Stake
articles.snippet: The investment bank became the latest to seek a lifeline from the East as it wrote down $10 billion in mortgage-related assets.
articles.abstract: The investment bank became the latest to seek a lifeline from the East as it wrote down $10 billion in mortgage-related assets.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, Dec. 10  UBS became the latest Western bank to seek a financial lifeline from the cash-rich East on Monday, selling a more than 10 percent stake to investors from Singapore and the Middle East, as it wrote down a further $10 billion in the value of its mortgage-backed assets.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Julia Werdigier

articles.headline: For a Few Dollars More, Dining Improves on Longer Flights
articles.snippet: US Airways, Midwest Airlines and Delta are among the first carriers to shift their menus in a more nutritional and flavorful direction.
articles.abstract: US Airways, Midwest Airlines and Delta are among the first carriers to shift their menus in a more nutritional and flavorful direction.
articles.lead_paragraph: Now that the airlines have had a few years of experience selling food in the coach cabin instead of including it in the price of a ticket, they are applying the lessons they have learned to a new round of “buy on board” options.

articles.headline: A Battle Fought in the Factories
articles.snippet: To the ire of Chinese steelworkers, the United States is set to impose new tariffs on Chinese steel pipe imports early next year.
articles.abstract: To the ire of Chinese steelworkers, the United States is set to impose new tariffs on Chinese steel pipe imports early next year.
articles.lead_paragraph: WEIFANG, China, Dec. 8  When the aging state-owned Weifang East Steel Pipe factory here in China’s northern coastal plains fell into insolvency a few years ago, unpaid workers at first responded by blocking the factory gates and marching angrily on a nearby municipal building.

articles.headline: Ask.com Puts a Bet on Privacy
articles.snippet: The fourth-largest search engine company will begin a service Tuesday called AskEraser, which allows users to make their searches more private.
articles.abstract: The fourth-largest search engine company will begin a service Tuesday called AskEraser, which allows users to make their searches more private.
articles.lead_paragraph: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 10  Will privacy sell?
